title: Can you speak cat? Scientists develop quiz that reveals how well you understand our feline friends
summary: Cats are excellent at communicating, but humans still routinely misunderstand them.

title: Archaeologists find 'unique' blood-red gemstone at Roman fort beyond Hadrian's Wall
summary: Archaeologists discovered the engraved gemstone at Bremenium, a fort north of Hadrian's Wall.

title: How to Follow the Trajectory of Comet 3I/Atlas
summary: The interstellar comet 3I/Atlas reached its closest point to the sun. Here's how to follow the rest of its journey away from our solar system.

title: نفقات العلاج… لماذا تضخمت التعويضات؟
summary: تحول تعميم التغطية الصحية من مشروع مجتمعي إلى عنصر جذب للاستثمار، الذي ارتفع حجمه بشكل لافت، مع تقدم تنزيل مضامين ومكونات هذا الورش الملكي.مستثمرون ضخوا رؤوس أموالهم في هذا القطاع الواعد، إذ أن منعشين عقاريين وصناعيين قرروا تنويع استثماراتهم بالولوج إلى القطاعات ذات الصلة. “الصباح” بحثت عنأكمل القر…
body: تحول تعميم التغطية الصحية من مشروع مجتمعي إلى عنصر جذب للاستثمار، الذي ارتفع حجمه بشكل لافت، مع تقدم تنزيل مضامين ومكونات هذا الورش الملكي.مستثمرون ضخوا رؤوس أموالهم في هذا القطاع الواعد، إذ أن منعشين عقاريين وصناعيين قرروا تنويع استثماراتهم بالولوج إلى القطاعات ذات الصلة. “الصباح” بحثت عن أكمل القراءة » المقالة نفقات العلاج… لماذا تضخمت التعويضات؟ fمنشورة على جريدة الصباح .

title: تبييض أموال يورط بارون كوكايين
summary: متابع أمام قاضي التحقيق بعد إيقافه بالبيضاء بناء على مذكرة بحث لدرك فحص أنجرة تلاحق تهمة تبييض أموال، بارون كوكايين و”الشيرا”، يوجد رهن الاعتقال الاحتياطي بأمر من قاضي التحقيق بالمحكمة الابتدائية بطنجة، بعد إيقافه من قبل مصالح أمن البيضاء، بناء على مذكرة بحث وطنية صادرة عن الدركأكمل القراءة » المقا…
body: متابع أمام قاضي التحقيق بعد إيقافه بالبيضاء بناء على مذكرة بحث لدرك فحص أنجرة تلاحق تهمة تبييض أموال، بارون كوكايين و”الشيرا”، يوجد رهن الاعتقال الاحتياطي بأمر من قاضي التحقيق بالمحكمة الابتدائية بطنجة، بعد إيقافه من قبل مصالح أمن البيضاء، بناء على مذكرة بحث وطنية صادرة عن الدرك أكمل القراءة » المقالة تبييض أموال يورط بارون كوكايين fمنشورة على جريدة الصباح .

title: Roman road network was twice as large as previously thought, new mapping project finds
summary: The new digital map increases the Roman road network by nearly 100%.

title: Scientists finally find explanation for lopsided cloud that follows Earth's moon through space
summary: The moon's oddly skewed dust cloud may be caused by an extreme day-night temperature difference, a new study suggests.

title: Global warming is forcing Earth's systems toward 'doom loop' tipping points. Can we avoid them?
summary: Earth may be on the verge of crossing several climate change tipping points that could have irreversible and devastating consequences. Here's everything you need to know about these "points of no return."

title: 20% off ALL Unistellar smart telescopes throughout November
summary: Save up to a huge $1,000 on all Unistellar telescopes and accessories this November in their Black Friday deal — just in time for dark sky season.

title: Astronomers discover bizarre 'runaway' planet that's acting like a star, eating 6 billion tons per second
summary: The James Webb and Very Large telescopes spotted a free-floating planet accreting material at a record rate, displaying behavior similar to how stars form. Scientists aren't clear as to why.

title: James Webb telescope makes first 3D map of an alien planet's atmosphere
summary: Astronomers using the James Webb Space Telescope have made the first 3D map of an alien planet's atmosphere, revealing extreme temperature swings on the exoplanet WASP-18b.

title: It's official: The world will speed past 1.5 C climate threshold in the next decade, UN says
summary: The UNEP's 2025 Emissions Gap report has found that global average temperatures will exceed 1.5 C (2.7 F) before 2035 — and this just days before the COP30 climate summit kicks off in Brazil.

title: 'Not so exotic anymore': The James Webb telescope is unraveling the truth about the universe's first black holes
summary: A peculiar object discovered by the James Webb Space Telescope just 700 million years after the Big Bang could reveal the origins of the earliest black holes in the universe, some experts say.

title: World's biggest spiderweb discovered inside 'Sulfur Cave' with 111,000 arachnids living in pitch black
summary: A giant colonial spiderweb in a sulfuric cave on the border between Greece and Albania may be the largest ever found — and it was built by spiders we didn't know liked the company of others.

title: Sink or swim? What will human migration look like as climate change impacts take hold
summary: In this excerpt from "Sink or Swim," author Susannah Fisher explores the future of human migration, and what that will look like based on the difficult choices we make in the coming years.

title: 2-mile-tall, naked 'Marree Man' looming over Australian outback is a total mystery — Earth from space
summary: A 2019 satellite photo shows the recently resurrected "Marree Man" geoglyph, which mysteriously appeared in the Australian outback in 1998. Experts are still unsure who created it.

title: Science history: Archaeologists discover King Tut's tomb, and rumors of the 'mummy's curse' begin swirling — Nov. 4, 1922
summary: While excavating in the Valley of the Kings, an Egyptian worker on an archaeological dig discovered a partially obscured step. It would lead into the unlooted tomb of King Tut.

title: China should undertake more risky research to close the Nobel gap
summary:
Nature, Published online: 04 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03615-2

China should undertake more risky research to close the Nobel gap
body: Nature, Published online: 04 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03615-2 China should undertake more risky research to close the Nobel gap

title: How I’m helping to cultivate science entrepreneurship in Brazil
summary:
Nature, Published online: 04 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03323-x

A course on disruptive innovation, and a supportive professional network, helped to unleash João Paulo Longo’s entrepreneurship skills.
body: Nature, Published online: 04 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03323-x A course on disruptive innovation, and a supportive professional network, helped to unleash João Paulo Longo’s entrepreneurship skills.

title: What are the signs that nature is telling us?' Scientists are triggering earthquakes in the Alps to find out what happens before one hits
summary: Researchers are deliberately setting off real (small) earthquakes to understand how to gauge the danger of a fault line before it breaks.

title: Astronomer reveals first look at Comet 3I/ATLAS as it reappears from behind the sun
summary: An astronomer has snapped comet 3I/ATLAS using the Lowell Observatory's powerful Discovery Telescope, as well as his own small telescope. The new photos are believed to be the first optical observations of the interstellar visitor since it disappeared behind the sun.

title: 5 common mistakes beginner macro photographers make — and how to avoid them
summary: New to macro photography? Avoid these 5 beginner mistakes and start capturing tiny worlds with big impact.

title: My funding applications are taking up too much time. How can I stay focused on my research?
summary:
Nature, Published online: 03 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03351-7

A young academic in China worries that the grant-application lottery is wasted effort.
body: Nature, Published online: 03 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03351-7 A young academic in China worries that the grant-application lottery is wasted effort.

title: First of its kind 'butt drag fossil' discovered in South Africa — and it was left by a fuzzy elephant relative 126,000 years ago
summary: The first hyrax fossil tracks and traces ever to be discovered were identified on South Africa's coast.

title: French archaeologists uncover 'vast Roman burial area' with cremation graves 'fed' by liquid offerings
summary: A massive Roman cremation cemetery in France is shedding light on diverse burial practices.

title: Webb reveals a fiery starburst in the Cigar Galaxy — Space photo of the week
summary: The James Webb Space Telescope has revealed the blazing heart of an iconic nearby galaxy, where rapid star formation and galactic winds light up the cosmos in infrared light.

title: The Bering Land Bridge has been submerged since the last ice age. Will scientists ever study it?
summary: Humans likely left a lot of archaeological evidence along the Bering Land Bridge when they crossed from Asia to Alaska during the last ice age. But will we ever be able to dive down to examine it?

title: We sharpened the James Webb telescope's vision from a million miles away. Here's how.
summary: A small piece of metal engineered in Australia helped sharpen the James Webb telescope's vision from a million miles away.

title: Chimps 'think about thinking' in order to weigh evidence and plan their actions, new research suggests
summary: Chimpanzees use a variation of the "scientific method" — discarding prior beliefs if convincing new evidence comes along to change their minds, research shows.

title: "سبيس إكس" تقترح على ناسا خطة لإرسال البشر إلى القمر
summary: أعلنت شركة سبيس إكس، المملوكة للملياردير الأميركي إيلون ماسك، الخميس، أنها اقترحت على إدارة الطيران والفضاء الأميركية (ناسا) خطة مبسطة لإرسال البشر إلى القمر.

title: سرقة اللوفر.. توقيف مشتبه بهما ومحاولة هروب من المطار
summary: أوقفت السلطات الفرنسية رجلين، مساء السبت، في إطار التحقيق في سرقة مجوهرات تاريخية من متحف اللوفر في باريس يوم 19 أكتوبر الجاري، وفق ما أكد مصدران مطلعان مؤكدين معلومات أوردتها وسائل إعلام محلية، الأحد.
